titleStmt.title: H. E. Luton to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7061

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excelency Thos. E Bramlette
Governer

I would state that I was captain of company B capital guard under command of Major M. A. Pain at Paducah Kentucky & Lofton H Mitchell was orderly seargant in my company and made a good soldier. That we was ordered by Major M. A. Payne to Trigg County with orders to Press horses from off of rebel sympathyzers, and take all arms and contraband, and that L H Mitchell had orders to take the Horse of Degraffenread, I further state that Degraffenread was a Rebel sympathyzer from Report of the deepest Dye
The above statement was subscribed and sworn to before me by H, E, Luten this 16th day of Sept 1865
